reviews.text: We spent 1 night here while on vacation in Israel. It was a great little hotel and great value as well. It's friendly, clean and comfortable with a nice breakfast and helpful staff. A great restaurant in the neighborhood is Ida. It was recommended by the hotel staff, and someone we chatted with on the beach. You also get a discount through the hotel.
reviews.title: Great small hotel in nice little town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our group had 4 rooms, ours was newly renovated, but all were very nice and clean, although small.
reviews.title: they could not have been more helpful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Small, comfortable family owned hotel run by the proprietor and her charming daughter.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel by the Med in Israel

reviews.text: Very reasonably priced, minutes from the beach and the fleshpots of Nahariya.
reviews.title: Great 5 night stay,in a laid back beach town without the hustle

reviews.text: There was a delightful sitting area out front and a lovely garden in the rear for a quiet rest after a day's busy sightseeing.
reviews.title: Family run, clean and roomy

reviews.text: In contrast to the last two hotels we stayed in; Dan Panorama in Haifa and Holiday Inn in Tiberias, this has been the least expensive, yet the friendliest with the largest room. On top of it free internet access. This hotel is owned run by a young lady (3rd generation owner, grandmother, father and now her), and has a family like atmosphere.
reviews.title: Very nice and friendly place.
